content: v2025 01 21 tidepool beanie © 2025 margaret sy 🌊 tidepool beanie 🖨 this condensed version of the crochet pattern is intended for printing or quick reference the extended version with more photos and tips is available at margaretmakesthings com/blog/tidepool-beanie-crochet-pattern ● measurements 10 across at the base of the hat when laid flat i e 20 brim circumference and ~11 5 long after seaming it should comfortably fit most adults ● stitches used in us crochet terms chain single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet yarn over slip_stitch ● construction the hat is worked in a single flat piece and then joined with a single_crochet and mattress stitch seam the row run vertically so the foundation chain determines the length and the hat grows width-wise as it works up the crown is shaped using short row ● gauge is 12 row in pattern = 4 and 17 stitches in pattern = 4 for worsted weight yarn with a suggested 5 0 mm crochet hook tight crocheters may want to size up to a 5 5 mm hook row gauge is more important than stitch gauge for this pattern pick a yarn and hook combo that gives you the row gauge and adjust the stitch counts so that the hat remains a length of 11 5 -12 if you make it longer than that you ll probably need a second skein ● suggested yarn is malabrigo rios and you will need about 200 yds just under one 210yd/100g skein pattern syntax ● instructions *n means work the stitches specified in instructions x n times for example 1 single_crochet 1 double_crochet *3 expands to 1 single_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 single_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 single_crochet 1 double_crochet ● r# # …instructions… means if the text says r01 50 that is short for in row 1 there are a total of 50 stitches ● all stitches are made in the back loop only except the last stitch in every odd numbered row is worked into both loops to create a smoother edge ● all row end in 1 chain and turn and this chain is not included in the row s stitch count pattern adjustments ● you can adjust the length of the hat by adding or removing stitches in the foundation chain extend or shorten the row by adding or removing stitches on the side that will be the bottom of the hat i e beginning of even numbered row end of odd numbered row ● if you adjust the length of the foundation chain keep the number of stitches to a multiple of 5 in order to keep the half_double_crochet s at the bottom edge for a neat finish for example if you decide to make the hat 55 stitches long instead of 50 stitches your edited r01 and r02 would be r01 55 5 single_crochet 3 single_crochet 2 half_double_crochet 3 double_crochet 2 half_double_crochet *5 1 v2025 01 21 tidepool beanie © 2025 margaret sy r02 45 45 yoslst if you decide to make the hat
